name: Interface Connector.BooleanArgument
text:
Specification for and value of a Connector argument,
 whose value is Boolean.  Boolean values are represented
 by the localized versions of the strings "true" and "false".
codes:
public static interface Connector.BooleanArgument
extends Connector.Argument

methods.description: Sets the value of the argument.
Performs basic sanity check of argument.

Return the string representation of the value
 parameter.
 Does not set or examine the current value of this
 instance.

Return the value of the argument as a boolean.  Since
 the argument may not have been set or may have an invalid
 value isValid(String) should be called on
 Connector.Argument.value() to check its validity.  If it is invalid
 the boolean returned by this method is undefined.
